definition: the adult male of the domestic chicken (Gallus gallus) : rooster
the male of birds other than the domestic chicken
woodcock
the crowing of a cock, cockcrow
weathercock
a device (such as a faucet or valve) for regulating the flow of a liquid
examples: the cock of an automobile radiator

definition: a chief person : leader
a person of spirit and often of a certain swagger or arrogance
the hammer in the lock of a firearm
the cocked position of the hammer
penis
one that dominates a group or situation especially overbearingly
examples: He was strutting around like the cock of the walk after he got a promotion.

definition: strut, swagger
examples: did a lot of bragging and cocking after winning the game

definition: to turn, tip, or stick up
examples: a horse's tail cocking almost straight up

definition: to position the hammer (see hammer entry 1 sense 2b(2)) of a firearm for firing
to draw the hammer of (a firearm) back and set for firing, to set (the trigger) for firing
to draw or bend back in preparation for throwing or hitting
to set (a mechanism, such as a camera shutter) for tripping (see trip entry 1 sense transitive 3)
to set erect
examples: a dog with one ear cocked

definition: to turn, tip, or tilt usually to one side
to turn up (something, such as a hat brim)
to thumb one's nose
examples: cocking a snook at the establishment

definition: tilt, slant
examples: the jaunty cock of his hat

definition: a small pile (as of hay)
to put (hay or something similar) into small piles
